keyword: calories in tacos at jack in the box
title: Calories in Tacos at Jack in the Box
meta_description: Discover calories in tacos at Jack in the Box for a standard 2-taco serving, including macros, sodium, and fast-food nutrition details with tweaks.
h1: Calories in Tacos at Jack in the Box
assumptions: Standard regular beef tacos with lettuce, cheese, and taco sauce; no modifications; based on typical Jack in the Box nutrition.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, portion size, and customizations. Check the Jack in the Box app or site for latest values.

quick_answer.text: Two Jack in the Box tacos have about 280 kcal, 14 g protein, and 620 mg sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with fast-food info.

tweaks.label: Add extra cheese to each taco
Monster Taco version (larger, with more fillings) per taco
No sauce (remove taco sauce from each)

faqs.q: How many calories in one Jack in the Box taco?
faqs.a: About 140 kcal per standard regular taco.

faqs.q: What are the macros for tacos at Jack in the Box?
faqs.a: For two tacos: 20 g carbs, 14 g protein, 16 g fat.

faqs.q: Are Jack in the Box tacos high in sodium?

faqs.q: Calories in Jack in the Box tacos with modifications?
faqs.a: Base is 140 kcal each; extras like cheese add 50+ kcal per taco.

faqs.q: Do Jack in the Box tacos have trans fats?
faqs.a: Typically 0 g trans fat per taco, but confirm with current menu data.
